Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Piece

  •  class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds useful information concerning individual pieces.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean CanIAttack(int newx, int newy)
      returns whether or not this piece can attack the piece on the board represented by newx, newy
      boolean CanIMoveTo(int newx, int newy)
      checks the newx and newy parameter against the valid_moves array returns true if the move can be done (the coordinates are in the valid_moves array) returns false if the move cannot be done (no matching coordinates in the valid_moves array)
      void move(int newx, int newy, Game g)
      Move a piece.
      void UpdateMoves(Game g)
      Update the valid_moves array

      • Piece

        public Piece(int xx,
     int yy,
     int pieceord,
     Piece.COLORS pc,
     Game info)
        Parameters:
        xx - x position
        yy - y position
        pieceord - integer value representing a place in the PIECES enum
        pc - the color of this piece
        info - a link to the main Game object

    • Method Detail

      • CanIMoveTo

        public boolean CanIMoveTo(int newx,
                 int newy)
        checks the newx and newy parameter against the valid_moves array returns true if the move can be done (the coordinates are in the valid_moves array) returns false if the move cannot be done (no matching coordinates in the valid_moves array)

      • CanIAttack

        public boolean CanIAttack(int newx,
                 int newy)
        returns whether or not this piece can attack the piece on the board represented by newx, newy

        Move a piece.
        Parameters:
        newx - destination x position
        newy - destination y position
        g - link to the main Game object
